title: About chat restriction
body: It's funny how a person can be chat restricted, just because it was a 4 people queuing, and they happen to know 3 other people on the enemy team. I was reported recently by 4 people queue just because they think me speaking English on NA server is deemed unworthy of their culture. I find it amusing how the tribunal system works like this. I'm not complaining about being chat restricted, because I did say some things deserving and worthy of it. However, I find it amusing how a person can be punished because he is not playing in dyanmic queue. Has riot come to this point where reprimanding others based on culture is a thing?

replies.body:
A 4 man premade has the same weight as a single player when it comes to reports. Your chat restriction should have come with a chat log. Can we see it?

Edit: I missed that. Okay, so, you agree you deserved the chat restriction. You are just upset that a premade seems to be at fault. Well, no, you are the one at fault. They didn't force you to say the stuff that would get you chat restrictions.

Having a system that detects a person for saying the racist N word, or cursing other players is easy if just a single person reports them over a few games to detect and punish, while having 2 or more of your own team Plus enemy team reporting a player for possibly trolling or for going on tilt /feeding for insert reason here seems like it would have more of an effect on a person, take for example to filter out (False Reports) of trolling the system would punish or take into account games where 2 or more of the people on the team reported plus have more of a effect when enemy's from the enemy team report them as well...

I am really curious to the facts Riot after having my last game getting me suspended for 2 weeks for Intentional Feed because of having my role stolen and unable to play as good as I could have, then being threaten reports at the end game screen and how a couple of players said they were reporting me on enemy team Plus I know the troll and at least another on my own team did keep in mind I said nothing but two sentences all game, and muted everyone in game because I knew it was going to be toxic.

Hey Tantram,

Ok so it only takes a single report to get the system going.  There may be no need for more than one reports, but what happens when there are more?  Are multiple reports the exact same as a single report or do they effect the system differently?  We've been led to believe we have a report weight based on the amount of accurate reports.  Is this true?

Not sure if you can disclose this information (and if you can't, just say it so that we won't bug you about it)...

But what constitutes "troll" or inaccurate reports?
Very curious to know so that us players, who take the time to write up reports, are actually being heard and not having our reports discarded because of a system's filtering process.

Games are reviewed by a program and if appropriate by a person, depending possibly on the report itself or what the program finds (they don't tell us the details on purpose because it makes it harder to cheat the system when we don't know).

The system doesn't punish people for reports that are found false, that's what filtering out inaccurate reports means.

The text box is there because games are often reviewed by people, which I suspect is more likely if you in fact use the text box.
